systemMessages.MP_PAYMENT_ID_NOT_FOUND: Unable to find the payment's ID.

systemMessages.MP_PREFERENCE_ID_NOT_FOUND: The preference's ID wasn't find in the payment.
systemMessages.TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND: Unable to find the payment's transaction.
systemMessages.TRAINER_HAS_ACTIVE_CONTRACT: It's not possible to delete or deactivate the profile while there are active contracts.
systemMessages.TRAINER_CANNOT_BE_CONTRACTED: This trainer cannot be contracted in this moment.
systemMessages.ERROR_LIMIT_SAVED_TRAINERS: You have reached the limit of 10 saved trainers profiles.
systemMessages.ERROR_LIMIT_PAYMENT_PLANS: You have reached the limit of 6 payment plans.
systemMessages.ERROR_LIMIT_TRAINING_PLANS: You have reached the limit of 20 training plans.

systemMessages.INVALID_PAYMENT_PLAN_DATA: The price or duration of the plan exceeded the allowed limit.

welcomeDescription: The best platform for you, bodybuilder or trainer, to manage your workouts.
name: Name
alertName: Name must be between 3 and 100 characters.
alertPassword: Password must be between 10 and 20 characters, with at least one symbol, number, and letter.
notFoundContactInfo: Your contact information was not found. Try logging in or registering again.
confirmIdentityDescription: Fill in the boxes below with the code we sent you.
notFoundUserInfo: Your user information was not found. Try registering again.
configDescription: Configure your profile for a more personalized experience!
configAlert: You can always change your settings after creating your account.
anonymousComplaintDescription: Enable this so your profile is not displayed in complaints you make.
anonymousRatingDescription: Enable this so your profile is not displayed in reviews you make.
emailNotificationsDescription: Enable this so you receive our email notifications.
darkThemeDescription: Enable this to have a darker interface colors.
englishDescription: Enable this so the app text is in English.
signUpAsTrainer: I want to sign up as a trainer
photoAlert: Select a JPG, JPEG, PNG, or WEBP photo of up to 2mb.

alertTrainerDescription: The professional description must not exceed 1200 characters or 15 line breaks.
limitAlertTrainingPlans: You have reached the limit of 20 training plans.
removeConfirmTrainingPlan: Do you want to remove this plan permanently?

limitAlertTrainingDays: You have reached the 9-day limit for this training plan.
removeConfirmTrainingDay: Do wou want to remove this day of your plan?
createTrainingPlanDescription: Create a complete training plan to use with as many clients as you want!
alertTrainingPlanName: The name must be between 1 and 50 characters.
alertNote500: The note must be no longer than 500 characters.
notFoundTrainingPlanInfo: The training plan information was not found.
errorAlertCreateTrainingDay: There are still errors in the training day form!
limitAlertCardioSessions: You have reached the limit of 4 cardio sessions for this training day.
limitAlertTrainingSteps: You have reached the limit of 12 exercises/sequences for this training day.
removeConfirmCardioSession: Do you want to remove this cardio session from your workout?
removeConfirmTrainingStep: Do you want to remove this exercise/sequence from your workout?
restDayDescription: Enable this to make this day a rest day.
trainingDayNamePlaceholder: Enter the name of the workout
alertTrainingDayName: The name must be between 1 and 50 characters.
alertErrorCardioSession: There are still errors in the cardio session form!
alertCardioDurationMinutes: The duration must be between 10 and 600 minutes.
limitAlertExercises: You have reached the limit of 4 consecutive exercises for this training step.
removeConfirmExercise: Do you want to remove this exercise from the sequence?
alertErrorExercise: There are still errors in the exercise form!
limitAlertSets: You have reached the 10-set limit for this exercise.
removeConfirmSet: Do you want to remove this set from your workout?
pulleyHeightPlaceholder: Select the height of the pulley
alertErrorSet: There are still errors in the set form!
repsOrIsometry: Fill in either the repetitions or isometric time fields
durationSecondsPlaceholder: Enter the duration of the isometric hold
restSeconds: Rest Time for Set in Seconds
alertMinReps: The minimum number of repetitions must be less than the maximum and between 1 and 100.
alertMaxReps: The maximum number of repetitions must be greater than the minimum and between 1 and 100.
alertDurationSeconds: The isometric hold time must be between 5 and 600 seconds.
alertRestSeconds: The rest time must be between 15 and 600 seconds.
chatbotDescription: I'm here to answer all your bodybuilding questions, so ask me anything you want
limitAlertPaymentPlanBenefits: You can display up to 8 benefits in the payment plan.
removeConfirmPaymentPlanBenefit: Do you want to remove this benefit from your plan?
createPaymentPlanDescription: Create a custom payment plan to attract more clients!
alertPaymentPlanName: The name must be between 1 and 50 characters.
alertPaymentPlanFullPrice: The plan price must be between R$ 9.99 and R$ 50,000.00.
alertPaymentPlanDurationDays: The contract duration must be between 1 day and 2 years.
alertPaymentPlanDescription: The description must be no longer than 500 characters.
alertBenefitDescription: The benefit description must be between 5 and 300 characters.
contractsEnding: You have reached the end of your contracts!
limitAlertPaymentPlans: You have reached the limit of 6 payment plans.
removeConfirmPaymentPlan: Do you want to remove this payment plan?
errorOcurredPaymentPlans: An error occurred while loading your payment plans!
errorOcurredContracts: An error occurred while loading your contracts!
reloadOrTryLater: Reload the page or try again later.
noContracts: You don't have any contracts yet.
alertTransactionId: This ID is useful for tracking and verifying payment, especially in support cases. Use it as a reference.
errorTrainingContract: Failed to load training information and active contract!
cancelContractConfirm: Do you want to cancel your active contract? You will not receive a refund and will no longer have access to the current training plan.
errorOcurredTrainingContract: An error occurred while loading your training and contract information!
errorOcurredTrainers: An error occurred while loading trainers!
searchTrainersInstruction: Search for trainers and choose one of their payment plans.
noTrainingSended: Your trainer has not sent you a workout yet
noTrainerPaymentPlans: The trainer does not have any payment plans yet
errorConnection: Connection error! Verify your connection or try again.
successAuth: You have been successfully authenticated. Enjoy FitX!
errorNotClient: This page can only be accessed by regular users.
errorNotTrainer: This page can only be accessed by trainers.
errorStateTrainingPlan: Error in the current state of the training plan!
errorTrainingPlanMinWorkouts: The training plan must have at least one day with training or cardio!
errorTrainingDaysMinLength: The training plan must have at least two training days!
errorTrainingDay: Invalid data on the training day
needsToHaveAtLeastOneExercise: must have at least one exercise
needsToHaveAtLeastOneSet: needs to have at least one set
recoverPasswordPlaceholder: Fill in the boxes below with your FitX account's e-mail and a new password for it.
noRatingsFinded: The trainer hasn't yet received any reviews.
noComplaintsFinded: The trainer hasn't yet received any complaints.
alertRatingComment: The comment must be no longer than 255 characters.
alertComplaintReason: The reason must be no longer than 255 characters.
errorOcurredRatings: An error occurred while loading reviews!
errorOcurredComplaints: An error occurred while loading complaints!
noRatings: You've reached the end of the reviews!
noComplaints: You've reached the end of the complaints!
removeConfirmComplaint: Do you want to remove your complaint
removeConfirmRating: Do you want to remove your review?
deactivateProfileConfirm: Do you want to deactivate your profile? Other users on the platform will no longer be able to interact with you until it is reactivated.
successDeactivateProfile: Profile deactivated! Login to FitX with your account details to activate it again.
deleteAccountConfirm: Do you want to delete your account? All your data will be erased without any chance of recovery. If you're a client and have a active contract, so it will be rescinded.
logoutConfirm: Do you want to log out of FitX?
modifyEmailConfirm: Do you want to modify your e-mail?
alreadyMPConnected: You are already connected to Mercado Pago!
connectMPInstruction: To receive payments, you need to create a account in Mercado Pago and connect to it through the FitX.
errorCreatePay: Failed when trying to pay plan!
paymentSuccessAlert: Now you can chat with your new coach, receive training plans, and track your progress under professional supervision!
paymentFailureAlert: The payment could not be completed! See below for possible reasons for this failure:
paymentPendingAlert: Payment has not yet been completed! Please wait until this process is complete so the contract can be created or try a new contract if it fails.
mpFeeAlert: The amount the trainer receives will be the plan price defined below minus the 0,99% to 5% fee charged by Mercado Pago.
maxActiveContracts: Maximum Number of Simultaneous Active Contracts
alertMaxActiveContracts: The maximum number of simultaneous active contracts must be between 1 and 30.
pauseContractsInstruction: With hiring paused, you can no longer be contracted, but your active contracts will still be ongoing.
unpauseContractsConfirm: Do you want to unpause hiring? This will allow you to be contracted again, unless your limit for simultaneous active contracts has been reached.
pauseContractsConfirm: Do you want to pause hiring? This action can be undone at any time.
trainerCannotBeContracted: This trainer cannot be contracted at this time. Save this profile to easily check their availability.
savedTrainersInstruction: Save up to 10 trainers you like or want to hire when a spot becomes available!
someDeactiveProfilesAlert: Some profiles may not be displayed because they're deactive.
searchDateError: The month and year fields must have a value if the day field is populated.
createAccountTerms: I accept the terms and conditions of FitX to create my account.
createTrainerTerms: I accept the terms and conditions of FitX for the use of services for trainers.
createPaymentPlanTerms: I accept the fee charged for this plan, the refund policy and the risks in the hiring processes presented in the FitX Terms and Conditions.
moreRefundInfo: More information about refund policies can be found in the 'Refund Policy' section below.
aboutTheFitXClientAlert: The refund policy and client resources and benefits comply with the Código de Defesa do Consumidor and applicable laws.
payPlanTerms: I agree to the FitX client terms and refund policy, confirming that I understand the information about the service to be delivered and the respective payment plan.
clientContractFeature1: As a FitX client, you can only maintain one active contract at a time, directly linked to a payment plan selected at the time of purchase.
clientContractFeature2: The main contract data, such as duration and value, are defined by the selected plan and don't change even if the trainer later deletes or modifies the values or conditions of the respective plan.
clientContractFeature3: In addition to the amount set by the trainer in your plan, a FitX service fee will be applied, ranging from 5% to 8%, depending on the price range of the plan you choose. This fee is used to cover platform maintenance, operational costs, and guarantee resources for support and refunds. The total amount to be paid by the customer and the amount of the fee will always be clearly specified in the payment plan and before finalizing the purchase.
clientContractFeature4: All contracted benefits and services are the sole responsibility of the trainer. FitX doesn't guarantee the delivery of these services, but offers support and refund mechanisms if the client is not satisfied.
clientContractFeature5: During the contract period, communication between the client and trainer is conducted exclusively through the FitX platform, ensuring greater security and organization.
clientContractFeature6: The client can request a refund at any time, and the refund may be in full or as defined by the trainer in the payment plan. If the trainer chooses to cancel the contract on their own initiative, the amount paid will be refunded in full.
clientContractFeature7: If the client chooses to deactivate their profile while the contract is active, the contract will remain in effect until the end of the contracted period. During this time, the trainer will not be able to send messages or provide any services to the client, as the account will be inactive. To resume communication and receipt of contracted services, the client must reactivate their profile on FitX.
refundTerm1: FitX guarantees the client the right to cancel a contract and request a refund at any time, in accordance with Brazilian law and the Código de Defesa do Consumidor.
refundTerm2: Within the first 7 days after contract, the client is entitled to a full refund of the amount paid, regardless of the use of the services. After this period, the refund will follow the rules established by the trainer in the chosen payment plan.
refundTerm3: After the legal 7-day cooling-off period, all refund requests will be subject to a 10% administrative fee on the amount paid. This fee is intended solely to cover financial and operational processing costs of the FitX platform and does not represent additional profit. This fee does not apply to cancellations made within the 7-day period guaranteed by the Código de Defesa do Consumidor, which always results in a full refund.
refundTerm4: In addition to the application of the 10% administrative fee to the refund requested by the client after the legal 7-day cooling-off period, the amount corresponding to the FitX service fee (charged at the time of purchasing the plan) will not be refunded. The refund, therefore, will be calculated only on the purchase amount, minus the administrative fee.
refundTerm5: After submitting a cancellation request, the trainer may contact the client within 10 days to attempt to reverse the decision. The client may withdraw the cancellation request at any time during this period.
refundTerm6: If the trainer accepts the request or doesn't respond within 10 days, the refund will be processed automatically, based on the date the request was submitted by the client. If the contract ends with a pending request, the refund will also be processed automatically, always based on the date of the request.
refundTerm7: If the client deletes their FitX profile, the contract will automatically end, and if there is a cancellation request in progress, it will be permanently canceled/deleted, with no possibility of recovery or future refund.
refundTerm8: After the refund is processed, the contract ends, the trainer's services are no longer provided, and communication between the client and trainer on the platform ends.
refundTerm9: Furthermore, the trainer can cancel the contract at will, without the client's approval. In this case, the amount paid is refunded in full, regardless of the duration of use or the date of cancellation.
mpRedirect: When you click 'Pay', you will be redirected to the Mercado Pago payment page, where you will have 5 minutes to make the payment
planPriceFeeClient: The amount displayed on the plan card already includes the FitX service maintenance fee, which is charged to the client. The amount you set and the fee amount can be found in the plan details.
feeInPlanAlert: The amount highlighted on the plan card already includes the FitX fee, which can be found just below this amount.
deletedPaymentPlanAlert: The plan linked to this contract has been deleted.
forMoreContractInfo: for more information about the FitX client and the resources available during the contract period.
failureReason2: Card not authorized or awaiting authorization.
failureReason7: Payment not made within the deadline.

1.name: Triceps French Curl
1.description: Push a weight upward with your arms overhead. Move only your forearm.

2.name: Triceps Pulley
2.description: Push a weight downward with your arms at your sides on a high pulley. Move only your forearm.

3.name: Triceps Forehead
3.description: Push a weight forward with your arms in front of your head. Move only your forearm.

4.name: Triceps Kickback
4.description: Push a weight backward with your arms at your sides while leaning forward on a high pulley. Move only your forearm.

5.name: Triceps Dip
5.description: Push a weight down with your arms at your sides. Use only your arm.

6.name: Wrist Curl
6.description: Move a weight with your arms still. Use only your wrist.

7.name: Wrist Adduction
7.description: Move a single weight toward your pinky finger with your arms still. Use only your wrist.

8.name: Wrist Abduction
8.description: Move a single weight toward your thumb with your arms still. Use only your wrist.

9.name: Finger Curl
9.description: Move a single weight with your arms still. Use only your fingers.

10.name: Hand Weight Support
10.description: Hold and hold a weight with your hands.

11.name: Wrist Roller
11.description: Twist and untwist a barbell attached to weights.

12.name: Traditional Barbell Curl
12.description: Pull a weight upward with your arms at your sides and your palms facing up. Move only your forearm.

13.name: Reverse Curl
13.description: Pull a weight up with your arms at your sides and your palms facing down. Move only your forearm.

14.name: Traditional Scott Curl
14.description: Pull a weight up with your arms resting in front of your torso and your palms facing up. Move only your forearm.

15.name: Reverse Scott Curl
15.description: Pull a weight up with your arms resting in front of your torso and your palms facing down. Move only your forearm.

16.name: Spider Curl
16.description: Pull a weight up with your arms hanging loosely in front of your torso while leaning forward. Move only your forearm.

17.name: Incline Curl
17.description: Pull a weight upward with your arms behind your torso. Move only your forearm.

18.name: Concentration Curl
18.description: Pull a weight toward your chest with your arms in front of your torso leaning forward. Move only your forearm.

19.name: Cross Curl
19.description: Pull a weight toward your head with your arms at your sides. Move only your forearm.

20.name: Bench Press
20.description: Push a weight in front of your torso. Move only your arm.

21.name: Incline Bench Press
21.description: Push a weight forward and upward from your torso. Move only your arm.

22.name: Decline Bench Press
22.description: Push a weight forward and downward from your torso. Move only your arm.

23.name: Straight Crucifix
23.description: Bring your arms together in front of your torso with them slightly bent. Move only your arm.

24.name: Declined Crucifix
24.description: Bring your arms together in front of your torso and close to your legs with them slightly bent. Move only your arm.

25.name: Inclined Crucifix
25.description: Bring your arms together in front of your torso and close to your head with them slightly bent. Move only your arm.

26.name: Flexion
26.description: Lie on the floor face down and push yourself up. Move only your arm.

27.name: Lateral Raise
27.description: Raise your arms alongside your torso with them slightly bent. Move only your arm.

28.name: Front Raise
28.description: Raise your arms together in front of your torso with them slightly bent. Move only your arm.

29.name: Reverse Crucifix
29.description: Pull a weight toward your back with your arms at shoulder height and slightly bent. Move only your arm.

30.name: Pressure
30.description: Push a weight up over your head. Move only your arm.

31.name: Upright Row
31.description: Pull a weight up to chest height. Move only your arm.

32.name: Face Pulldown
32.description: Pull a weight up toward your head with your arms at shoulder height. Move only your arm and shoulder.

33.name: Shrug
33.description: Pull your shoulders up with your arms still.

34.name: Pull Down
34.description: Pull a weight up to neck height with your arms overhead. Move only your arm and shoulder.

35.name: Traditional Row
35.description: Pull a weight toward your torso, either while supported, inclined, or on machines. Move only your arm and shoulder.

36.name: Horseback Row
36.description: Pull a weight toward your torso, while standing or leaning on a T-bar machine, using an angled path. Move only your arm and shoulder.

37.name: Low Row
37.description: Pull a weight toward your torso, while seated and on a low pulley. Move only your arm and shoulder.

38.name: Pulldown
38.description: Pull a weight up to your navel with your arms slightly bent and in line with your shoulders, using an angled path. Move only your arm and shoulder.

39.name: Pullover
39.description: Pull a weight up to your chest with your arms slightly bent and in line with your shoulders, using an angled path, while lying down. Move only your arm and shoulder.

40.name: Lumbar Extension
40.description: Lift your torso and extend your spine with your legs attached to a Roman bench. Move only your torso and spine.

41.name: Hammer Curl
41.description: Pull a weight up with your arms at your sides and your palms facing your torso. Move only your forearm.

42.name: Standing Calf Curls
42.description: Standing with your toes, lifting your heels. Move only your heel.

43.name: Seated Calf Curls
43.description: Seated with your legs bent, lifting your heels. Move only your heel.

44.name: Flexed Hip Calf Curls
44.description: Standing with your toes, lifting your heels, lifting your heels. Move only your heel.

45.name: Cold Curl Table
45.description: Pull a weight with it resting on your feet or the back of your shin, while lying down. Move only your knee.

46.name: Cold Curl Chair
46.description: Pull a weight with it resting on the back of your shin, while sitting. Move only your knee.

47.name: Standing Leg Curl
47.description: Pull a weight with it supported on the back of your shin, while standing. Move only your knee.

48.name: Stiff
48.description: Lift a weight from the floor with your hands and your legs slightly bent. Move only your hips.

49.name: Good Morning
49.description: Lift a weight supported on your back with your legs slightly bent. Move only your hips.

50.name: Nordic Curl
50.description: With your feet together and your shin supported, lower and raise your legs with your hips slightly bent. Move only your knee.

51.name: Pelvic Lift
51.description: Lift a weight with it supported on your hips and the backs and soles of your feet supported, while lying down. Move only your hips.

52.name: Chair Abductor
52.description: Open your legs with the lateral part of your thigh supported, while sitting. Move only your leg.

53.name: Standing Hip Abduction
53.description: Open your legs with the weight attached or supported by the heel, while standing. Move only your leg.

54.name: Glute Kickback
54.description: Push a weight behind your body with your legs. Move only your leg.

55.name: Bulgarian
55.description: Squat with one leg, with the foot of the other leg resting on a bench behind your torso. Move only your leg and hip.

56.name: Sumo Squat
56.description: Squat with your legs wide apart. Move only your leg and hip.

57.name: Sumo Deadlift
57.description: Lift a weight from the floor with your hands and legs wide apart. Move only your hips and leg.

58.name: Traditional Deadlift
58.description: Lift a weight from the floor with your hands, with your legs shoulder-width apart. Move only your hips and legs.

59.name: Romanian Deadlift
59.description: Lift a weight from the floor with your hands and with your hips higher than in a traditional deadlift. Move only your hips and legs.

60.name: Seated Hip Adductor
60.description: Close your legs with your inner thigh supported while seated. Move only your leg.

61.name: Standing Hip Adduction
61.description: Close your legs with the weight held or supported by your heel while standing. Move only your leg.

62.name: Seated Hip Extension
62.description: Push the weight in a kicking motion while seated or lying down. Move only your knee.

63.name: Traditional Squat
63.description: Squat with your legs shoulder-width apart and your weight supported by your back or held in your hands. Move only your leg and hips.

64.name: Front Squat
64.description: Squat with your legs shoulder-width apart and your weight supported by your shoulders in front of your torso. Move only your leg and hips.

65.name: Roman Squat
65.description: Squat with your legs shoulder-width apart, feet locked, and your calves supported. Move only your leg and hips.

66.name: Leg Press
66.description: Push a weighted platform using your legs, while sitting or lying down. Move only your leg.

67.name: Stride
67.description: Simulate walking with long strides and squatting with your front leg with each step. Move only your leg and hips.

68.name: Lunge
68.description: Squat with one leg, with the foot of the other leg resting on the floor behind your torso. Move only your leg and hips.

69.name: Climbing Crunch
69.description: Lie on your stomach and stand up with your arms resting on the floor while trying to bring your legs to your chest. Move only your legs.

70.name: Supra Crunch
70.description: Lie on your stomach, bend your legs, and raise your torso by arching your spine. Move only your torso and spine.

71.name: Lying Lower Crunch
71.description: Lie on your stomach and raise your legs, bending your spine. Move only your leg and spine.

72.name: Lower Crunch on Pull-Up Bar
72.description: Hold onto a pull-up bar and raise your legs, bending your spine. Move only your leg and spine.

73.name: Supported Lower Crunch
73.description: Support your arms and back and raise your legs, bending your spine. Move only your leg and spine.

74.name: Plank
74.description: Lie on your stomach and stay upright with your arms resting on the floor, torso and legs aligned.

75.name: Bicycle Crunch
75.description: Lie on your stomach with your legs and spine bent, simulating a pedal stroke. Rotate your torso and move only your leg.

76.name: Oblique Crunch on Pull-Up Bar
76.description: Hold onto a pull-up bar and raise your legs, bending your spine and rotating your torso. Rotate your torso and move only your leg and spine.

77.name: Lying Oblique Crunch
77.description: Lie on your stomach, bend your legs, and lift your torso while rotating it by flexing your spine. Rotate your torso and move only your torso and spine.

4.description: Sitting on the upright bench (with your back to the bench)

5.description: Sitting on the upright bench (facing the bench)

6.description: Sitting on the bench inclined at 75° (with your back to the bench)

7.description: Sitting on the bench inclined at 75° (facing the bench)

8.description: Sitting on the bench inclined at 60° (with your back to the bench)

9.description: Sitting on the bench inclined at 60° (facing the bench)

10.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 45° (on your back)

11.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 45° (face down)

12.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 30° (on your back)

13.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 30° (face down)

14.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 15° (on your back)

15.description: Lying on the bench inclined at 15° (face down)

16.description: Lying on the non-inclined bench (on your back)

17.description: Lying on the non-inclined bench (face down)

18.description: Lying on the bench declined at 15° (on your back)

19.description: Lying on the bench declined at 15° (face down)

20.description: Lying on the bench declined at 30° (on your back)

21.description: Lying on the bench declined at 30° (face down)

22.description: Lying on the bench declined at 45° (on your back)

23.description: Lying on the bench declined at 45° (face down)

24.description: Lying on the floor (on your back)

1.name: Dumbbells
1.description: Free weights used with one hand.

2.name: Barbell
2.description: Straight bar, W, H, or hexagonal bar.

3.name: Guided Barbell
3.description: Bar attached to a Smith machine.

6.name: Pulley
6.description: Equipment with pulleys and various accessories.

7.name: Elastic Band
7.description: Bands that resist or assist movement.

8.name: Ankle Weights
8.description: Weights attached to the ankles or wrists.

1.name: Drop Set
1.description: Two or more load reductions each time you reach failure in a set.

2.name: Rest-Pause
2.description: Two or more short rests each time you reach failure in a set.

3.name: Post-Set Partials
3.description: Partial repetitions after reaching failure in a set.

4.name: Elongated Phase Partials
4.description: Partial repetitions at the point of greatest elongation in the movement.

5.name: Contracted Phase Partials
5.description: Partial repetitions at the point of greatest contraction in the movement.

6.name: Forced Reps
6.description: Repetitions performed with assistance after reaching failure in a set.

7.name: Negative Reps
7.description: Repetitions performed with assistance during the concentric phase of the movement.

8.name: Cluster Set
8.description: Small divisions of a series with short pauses between them.

9.name: FST-7
9.description: Seven sets with short breaks between sets and maintaining a stretch in the target muscle during rests.

10.name: Dead Stop
10.description: Repetitions with a rest at the point of greatest elongation of the movement.

11.name: Peak Concentration
11.description: Repetitions with a pause at the point of greatest contraction of the movement.

12.name: Zero Point
12.description: Repetitions with a pause at the point of greatest elongation of the movement.

1.name: Warm-up
1.description: Low-intensity sets designed to lubricate joints, activate target muscles, and improve neuromuscular connectivity.

2.name: Feeder
2.description: Moderate-intensity sets used to adjust the load for main sets and reduce the risk of injury.

3.name: Work
3.description: Effective sets with sufficient intensity to reach or approach concentric failure within the prescribed repetition range.

4.name: Top
4.description: Effective sets with maximum intensity, performed to concentric or technical failure, within the prescribed repetition range.

1.description: Use of 50-60% of maximum heart rate.

2.description: Use of 60-70% of maximum heart rate.

3.description: Use of 70-80% of maximum heart rate.

4.description: Use of 80-90% of maximum heart rate.

5.description: Use of 90-100% of maximum heart rate.

6.description: Interval training with alternating periods of high and low intensity.
